title: redis backend to zipkin, CR by Dan Simon
body:
## motivation

we didn't want to use the cassandra backend, so we used made an alternative storage backend in redis.
## implementation

redis data structures are generally pretty good, but we needed slightly different ways of thinking about them for zipkin.  I have slightly different abstractions around them, which comprise most of this code.  Index and Storage end up mostly being just about manipulating those data structures.

title: Add UI complex query support
body:
Add feature to get traces based on an intersection of multiple annotations and/or key-value annotations. For example, traces that have both `url=/my/url.json` and `finagle.retry` annotations.

Changes:
- Add common classes QueryRequest, QueryResponse to mirror previously added thrift structs

Breaking changes:
- Some query form input field names have changed:
  - `service_name` to `serviceName`
  - `span_name` to `spanName`
  - `end_datetime` to `endDatetime`
  - `annotations` is now sent as an array of the form `annotations[0]`, `annotations[1]`, etc.
  - `annotation_key` and `annotation_value` are similarly sent as `keyValueAnnotations[0][key]`, `keyValueAnnotations[0][val]`, etc.

body: - Add endpoint `getTraceIds` that allows for queries that specify multiple annotations or binary annotations that must be satisfied. Expected result is the intersection of all traces that satisfy the conditions. This endpoint is intended to eventually replace the `getTraceIdBy*` endpoints.
